00076 /* warning: don't use these macros with a function, as it evals its arg twice */
00077 #define ITEM_get_cas(i) ((uint64_t)(((i)->it_flags & ITEM_CAS) ? \
00078                                     *(uint64_t*)&((i)->end[0]) : 0x0))
00079 #define ITEM_set_cas(i,v) { if ((i)->it_flags & ITEM_CAS) { \
00080                           *(uint64_t*)&((i)->end[0]) = v; } }
00081 
00082 #define ITEM_key(item) (((char*)&((item)->end[0])) \
00083          + (((item)->it_flags & ITEM_CAS) ? sizeof(uint64_t) : 0))
00084 
00085 #define ITEM_suffix(item) ((char*) &((item)->end[0]) + (item)->nkey + 1 \
00086          + (((item)->it_flags & ITEM_CAS) ? sizeof(uint64_t) : 0))
00087 
00088 #define ITEM_data(item) ((char*) &((item)->end[0]) + (item)->nkey + 1 \
00089          + (item)->nsuffix \
00090          + (((item)->it_flags & ITEM_CAS) ? sizeof(uint64_t) : 0))
00091 
00092 #define ITEM_ntotal(item) (sizeof(struct _stritem) + (item)->nkey + 1 \
00093          + (item)->nsuffix + (item)->nbytes \
00094          + (((item)->it_flags & ITEM_CAS) ? sizeof(uint64_t) : 0))

00097 #define APPEND_STAT(name, fmt, val) \
00098     append_stat(name, add_stats, c, fmt, val);
00099 
00102 #define APPEND_NUM_FMT_STAT(name_fmt, num, name, fmt, val)   \
00103     klen = sprintf(key_str, name_fmt, num, name);            \
00104     vlen = sprintf(val_str, fmt, val);                       \
00105     add_stats(key_str, klen, val_str, vlen, c);
00106 
00108 #define APPEND_NUM_STAT(num, name, fmt, val) \
00109     APPEND_NUM_FMT_STAT("%d:%s", num, name, fmt, val)

00280 typedef struct _stritem {
00281     struct _stritem *next;
00282     struct _stritem *prev;
00283     struct _stritem *h_next;    /* hash chain next */
00284     rel_time_t      time;       /* least recent access */
00285     rel_time_t      exptime;    /* expire time */
00286     int             nbytes;     /* size of data */
00287     unsigned short  refcount;
00288     uint8_t         nsuffix;    /* length of flags-and-length string */
00289     uint8_t         it_flags;   /* ITEM_* above */
00290     uint8_t         slabs_clsid;/* which slab class we're in */
00291     uint8_t         nkey;       /* key length, w/terminating null and padding */
00292     void * end[];
00293     /* if it_flags & ITEM_CAS we have 8 bytes CAS */
00294     /* then null-terminated key */
00295     /* then " flags length\r\n" (no terminating null) */
00296     /* then data with terminating \r\n (no terminating null; it's binary!) */
00297 } item;

00299 typedef struct {
00300     pthread_t thread_id;        /* unique ID of this thread */
00301     struct event_base *base;    /* libevent handle this thread uses */
00302     struct event notify_event;  /* listen event for notify pipe */
00303     int notify_receive_fd;      /* receiving end of notify pipe */
00304     int notify_send_fd;         /* sending end of notify pipe */
00305     struct thread_stats stats;  /* Stats generated by this thread */
00306     struct conn_queue *new_conn_queue; /* queue of new connections to handle */
00307     cache_t *suffix_cache;      /* suffix cache */
00308 } LIBEVENT_THREAD;

00349     int    sbytes;    /* how many bytes to swallow */

00352     struct iovec *iov;

00424 /*
00425  * Functions such as the libevent-related calls that need to do cross-thread
00426  * communication in multithreaded mode (rather than actually doing the work
00427  * in the current thread) are called via "dispatch_" frontends, which are
00428  * also #define-d to directly call the underlying code in singlethreaded mode.
00429  */
00430
